content.value_statement: Understanding context windows and attention mechanics is crucial for building effective AI agents. This skill teaches you how to optimize context usage, manage token budgets, and design efficient agent architectures.
actual_capabilities: Explains context components and their roles in AI systems
Teaches attention mechanics and budget constraints
Offers context optimization and token estimation techniques
Includes Python utilities for context management
Demonstrates context validation and truncation patterns
limitations: Educational content only - no active agent capabilities
Token estimation uses approximate 4 characters per token
Focused on Claude and Anthropic ecosystem patterns

output_examples.input: How do I structure context for a coding assistant that needs to understand project requirements, access documentation, and write code?
output: System Prompt: Define the assistant as a coding expert with clear behavioral constraints
Tool Definitions: Include file access, search, and code execution tools with detailed descriptions
Progressive Loading: Load project overview first, then specific documentation sections as needed
Context Budget: Allocate approximately 20% to system and tools, 60% to active task, 20% reserve
Message Management: Summarize long conversations every 10 to 15 turns to preserve key information

output_examples.input: What causes attention degradation in long context windows?
output: Attention budget: Token pairs create N-squared relationships that stretch thin as context grows
Training distribution: Models have less experience with long sequences from training data
Position encoding: Interpolation for longer contexts reduces precision for token position understanding
Mitigation: Place critical information at beginning and end where attention is highest

best_practices: Treat context as a finite resource with diminishing returns beyond optimal length
Place critical information at attention-favored positions (beginning and end of context)
Use progressive disclosure to load information only when needed for the current task
anti_patterns: Pre-loading all possible information instead of just-in-time loading strategies
Ignoring context degradation hoping larger context windows will solve memory issues
Using vague high-level guidance that fails to give concrete behavioral signals to the agent

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI platforms?
faq.answer: Concepts apply broadly but examples focus on Claude and Anthropic. Principles are universal for transformer-based models.

faq.question: What context limits should I design for?
faq.answer: Design for 70 to 80 percent of stated limits. Claude 3 models have 200K tokens but effective performance degrades beyond 150K.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing agent framework?
faq.answer: Yes. Patterns are framework-agnostic. Adapt the ContextBuilder class to your specific needs and language.

faq.question: How does this skill handle sensitive data in context?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on context structure and optimization. Implement your own data handling policies for sensitive information.

faq.question: My agent still hits limits after optimization. What is next?
faq.answer: Consider advanced techniques like context compression, summarization, and selective retention for further optimization.

faq.question: How does this compare to other context management approaches?
faq.answer: This skill provides foundational understanding. Other skills in the collection build on these basics for specific use cases.
